item.title: Anker Goes Full Giveaway on USB-C Cables, 60W 2-Pack Selling for Mere Pennies at Amazon
item.content:encoded:
USB-C is now the universal norm for charging and data on everything from smartphones to tablets to laptops, ending the cable chaos that had plagued tech users for decades. Even Apple gave up its Lightning connectors in favor of USB-C across all devices so now everyone needs quality USB-C-to-USB-C cables for charging and syncing.

At $6, down from $8, this Anker 2-pack works out to just $3 per cable for Apple-approved accessories from a brand trusted by millions. This record-low Black Friday price on Amazon makes stocking up on essential charging cables affordable enough to place them everywhere you need power.

See at Amazon

60W Fast Charging That Powers Real Devices

The capability for 60W power delivery manages fast charging for iPhones, iPads, MacBook Air and other USB-C devices that support Power Delivery protocols without bottlenecking charging speeds. This wattage proves enough to charge most phones at maximum speed and also supports tablet and laptop charging at respectable rates that keep most devices powered during use.

An iPhone 16 or 17 will charge from empty to 50% in roughly 30 minutes when paired with an appropriate 20W or higher charger, while an iPad will charge comfortably sans the frustratingly slow speeds that plague inadequate cables. The 60W rating provides headroom beyond what most phones require and ensures the cable never becomes the limiting factor in your charging setup even as devices demand more power in future generations.

The 3.3-foot length strikes the practical balance between reach and portability that makes these cables work across multiple usage scenarios. This length extends comfortably from wall outlets to nightstands or desks without excess cable creating tangled messes, while remaining short enough to pack neatly in bags without bulky coils. Bedside charging reaches from floor outlets to mattress height with ease, office setups connect from desktop power strips to devices on desks, and car charging extends from dashboard ports to passenger seats.

Apple’s approval from Anker offers the assurance of strict quality and safety standards that come inherently with the official compatibility certification process. What that means in real life is these cables will work seamlessly on your iPhones, iPads, and MacBooks without triggering any compatibility warnings or experiencing those frustrating connection issues like other, lesser, non-certified cables do. The extensive testing for electrical safety, data integrity, and durability makes sure such cables will not damage your expensive devices due to voltage irregularities or poor construction.

The two-pack quantity provides immediate redundancy by placing cables in several locations, rather than continually moving a single cable from room to room and risking loss or damage. Leave one cable at the side of your bed for overnight charging, using the second at the desk for daytime top-ups, or designate one for home and another for your work bag.

The fact that Anker is an Apple-approved accessory maker gives them a level of quality you just can’t get from some no-name cheap cables. If you want reliable USB-C cables without paying Apple’s premium pricing, this record-low deal makes essential charging infrastructure absurdly affordable.

item.title: Microsoft Cuts the Surface Laptop Harder Than Apple, Turning It Into a Black Friday Budget PC
item.content:encoded:
Have you upgraded your laptop recently? No? Well, if you’re still using a device that’s been around for like a decade, it might be time to consider replacing it. The 2024 Microsoft Surface Laptop is a fantastic, versatile option that can meet the needs of almost anyone—whether you’re a student, a small business owner, or simply someone looking for a more powerful device than using your phone for everything. Right now, you can save up to $450 on the 2024 model. This significant 38% discount brings the price down from $1,200 to as low as $750 for a limited time. And it’s not even officially Black Friday yet!

See at Amazon

Powerful Performance for Any Task

The Microsoft Surface Laptop is built with performance in mind. It features a choice between two processors: the Snapdragon X Elite 10-core or 12-core CPU. The 12-core processor is especially impressive, delivering speed that even outpaces the MacBook Air’s M3 chip, ensuring smooth and fast performance for all kinds of tasks. Whether you’re tackling school assignments, handling business operations, or simply browsing the web, this laptop can keep up without a hitch. It also offers 16GB or 32GB of memory, ensuring smooth multitasking and the ability to run demanding applications. Additionally, the 512GB storage capacity provides ample room for all your files, photos, and documents.

As expected with pretty much any tech product to release in the last couple years, the marketing for this laptop is leading with it’s support for AI features. Microsoft markets this Surface Laptop as built for the AI era, offering integration with Copilot+, which is their new AI assistant. Copilot+ can generate art from text prompts and help you easily access documents or websites. In addition to this, Copilot+ promises to improve video call quality by enhancing lighting, reducing background noise, and blurring distractions, though these features have been around for a while—just now labeled as AI.

Stunning Display & Versatile Design

The Surface Laptop boasts a large and vibrant display, available in 13.8-inch or 15-inch sizes. With HD resolution and support for HDR and DolbyVision IQ, the screen offers sharp visuals that bring all your content to life. Whether you’re watching videos, working on projects, or browsing, you can expect vibrant colors and clear details. The laptop also features a touchscreen, allowing you to easily switch between tablet mode for a more interactive experience or use it like a traditional laptop with the keyboard and mouse. The minimal bezel design maximizes the screen space.. Plus, it’s incredibly thin and lightweight, making it easy to carry between classes, work meetings, or perhaps your local coffee shop.

Convenient Port Selection & Impressive Battery Life

In terms of connectivity, the Microsoft Surface Laptop comes equipped with all the necessary ports, including two USB-C 4 ports for fast data transfer and charging. The laptop is also designed to be highly portable, with long-lasting battery life that can keep you going for up to 20 hours before needing to plug it back in.

Whether you need a reliable laptop for work, school, or personal use, the 2024 Microsoft Surface Laptop is an excellent choice. Get it now for as low as $750 ahead of Black Friday.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Might Be Headed For Its Own Embracer Moment
item.content:encoded:
Is Saudi Arabia’s takeover of EA another big-brain play or a sign of desperation? Can a more generous Black Ops 7 battle pass convince players to keep playing? What does James Cameron really think about Netflix? It’s another edition of Morning Checkpoint, our daily roundup of gaming news and culture.

As we skid into the long holiday weekend, I’m trying to decide exactly how many Black Friday discounted game controllers I should buy to replace the ones my kids keep breaking. Or maybe I should just stop paying my electricity bill and force them all to take up knitting instead.

Saudi Arabia is having an Embracer moment

The country’s Public Investment Fund has made a bunch of bad bets, according to The New York Times (via Game Developer). It reports that the sovereign wealth fund is running low on cash for new investments. You might remember one of them being a concept for a futuristic city in the desert in the shape of one long line.

This makes the fund’s massive bid to take EA private seem somewhat more desperate and precarious, given that much of it will be debt-financed at high interest rates. Embracer itself once looked to the PIF to save it, rapidly unraveling once a multi-billion dollar deal failed to materialize. It never recovered. We’ll see how long Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman can continue flooding the zone with oil money to whitewash the country’s human rights record.

Notably, the EA Saudi deal was reportedly facilitated by Jared Kushner, President Trump’s son-in-law. MBS recently visited the White House in exchange for fighter jets, advanced AI chips, and god knows what else. Trump brushed off MBS’s alleged role in having a Washington Post journalist murdered a few years back as “things happen” and claimed his family has done “little” business with the Kingdom. I guess the largest leveraged buyout of an American firm by a foreign entity is just table stakes these days.

The Black Ops 7 battle pass will be more generous than the Black Ops 6 one

You’ll still have to battle FOMO, but unlocks will come more easily. “The team has taken learnings from Black Ops 6’s Battle Pass completion times and made tuning adjustments for a more satisfying journey,” the devs wrote in a new blog post. “The result: each season’s Battle Pass in Black Ops 7 will be more rewarding for your time spent in-game, no matter where you’re playing across all parts of the game.”

Initial pages will be shorter, and players can earn Battle Pass Tokens from Daily Challenges including in the co-op campaign, in case you’re a glutton for punishment.

Palmer Luckey’s N64 clone is getting revealed soon

The ModRetro M64 hardware is getting a full reveal on Black Friday – features, colors, our incredible new controller, cutting-edge @AMD hardware, etc.

Much has changed since we launched early bird pricing at $199 earlier this year, things like inflation, component shortages,… pic.twitter.com/T8MLilyweh

— Palmer Luckey (@PalmerLuckey) November 25, 2025

The ModRetro M64 is the arms dealer’s latest side project: an FPGA machine that plays old N64 cartridges on modern displays. Despite things like “inflation, component shortages, tariffs, and more,” the price will remain $200, which is 20 percent less than the recently launched Analogue 3D. The devil will be in the details, however. Luckey says all will be revealed on Black Friday, though a holiday 2025 release seems like a long-shot at this point.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment gets a free update this week

The November 27 patch will add more weapons, enemies, and other small features, like some fresh team-up attacks for the musou fighter’s characters.

Helldivers 2 is getting jungle armor and giant chainsaws

The Python Commandos Warbond will go live for players on December 2. In addition to the new Contra-style kits, players will get the CQC-9 Defoliation Tool which looks like a long buzz-saw that will slice through enemies and trees alike.

Big Jim hates Netflix

The Avatar 3 director and box office giant James Cameron had some harsh words for the streamer’s Oscar strategy in a recent interview. “We’ll put the movie out for a week, we’ll put it out for 10 days; we’ll qualify for Academy Awards consideration,” he said, critiquing the company’s free-loading strategy. “See, I think that’s fundamentally rotten at the core. The Academy Awards, to me, mean nothing if they don’t mean theatrical.”

Basically, he’s accusing Netflix of trying to draft off of the prestige of awards nominations without actually investing in theaters, all while its platform is directly undercutting the broader movie-going experience. Personally, I think Cameron could do a lot more to help theaters by releasing good movies instead of more Avatar sequels, but his underlying logic is unimpeachable.

  • People are training for ICE raids inside Fortnite
  • Pokémon Legends: Z-A online battles are already super boring
  • Dan Houser is not buying all of the AI hype

item.title: This $0.02 per GB Seagate Hard Drive Deal Makes Storage Practically Free, Even the 1-Year Rescue Service Is Included

It’s that time of the year again. Early Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals are rolling in hot, which means you don’t really have to wait for the main event to start saving. Plenty of top-rated items across all categories (TVs, laptops, smartphones, kitchen appliances, games) have already dropped to their lowest prices ever. Finding the right discounts that are worth your hard-earned money, however, can be a little overwhelming during such times, but that’s where we come in to help. Our shopping team is keeping an eye on the best deals around, so you don’t have to!

Those looking for a reliable storage solution — we have good news. Seagate just dropped its massive 4TB external hard drive by 20%, which means you can bring it home for just $100 today. The discount is open to both Prime and non-Prime members, but Prime members will enjoy free shipping with their purchase, too. The product is also rated as Amazon’s Choice on the retailer. The deal, however, wraps up soon. Amazon hasn’t specified an end date for it, but we’re not expecting it to last more than a couple of days. If you have been wanting to expand the storage of your computer or gaming console without spending a ton, now is the time to act. Grab it before the price shoots back up to $125.

See at Amazon

Stores All Your Old and New Files

Running out of storage is never fun, and this drive is sure to take care of that issue for years to come. The storage capacity it offers is truly massive. 4TB storage means you will have space to house all your old and new data, which can include thousands of photos, hundreds of movies, years of backup, tons of research papers, an unusual number of work documents, plus all your favorite titles. And even after all of this, you will still have plenty of space left for future downloads. If you have ever been in a situation where you had to delete some of your old files to make room for new ones (like all of us), you’re going to greatly appreciate the peace of mind this brings.

It’s designed to work with Windows or Mac computers and select gaming consoles, with the setup being fairly straightforward. If you’re planning to use it with a Windows-based computer, you just need to plug in the power and then plug in the included USB cable. The drive should now appear in the (My) Computer/This PC and Windows Explorer/File Explorer. Using it with a Mac requires you to reformat the drive. Once that’s done, the system will detect the drive, and you can start using it.

This drive, despite the massive capacity it packs, is quite minimal and lightweight. It easily slides into a laptop bag without bulking things up, which makes it easier to take with you on the go when working remotely. You also don’t have to worry about losing your important data, as your purchase will include a year-long access to Seagate’s Rescue Data Recovery Services. The service connects you to a team of world-class data recovery experts, offers one in-lab data recovery attempt, and gets you an encrypted storage device containing your recovered data if recovery is successful.

In short, if you’ve been after a reliable storage solution for your important files, the Seagate 4TB external hard drive is a great option to consider, especially now that it’s available for just $100. It not only offers a massive capacity, but is compatible with a range of devices and is easy to use, as well.

item.title: Galaxy Z Flip 7 Makes Zero-Profit Play, Samsung Sells Foldable Cheaper Than Its Own Galaxy S25
item.content:encoded:
The Galaxy Z Flip 7 has become the phone that style enthusiasts actively desire and creates excitement in ways that standard flagship phones simply cannot match. The compact clamshell form factor when folded delivers visual impact that surpasses even iPhone’s polished design language, and transforms phones from utilitarian tools into fashion statements.

At $899 for the 256GB model, down from $1,099, and $1,019 for the 512GB version, down from $1,219, both configurations have hit record-low prices on Amazon for Black Friday that undercut traditional premium flagships. This seventh-generation foldable now costs less than many conventional flagship phones and delivers Samsung’s most refined folding experience yet.

See at Amazon

Dual Display System

The large 6.9-inch internal Dynamic AMOLED 2X display unfolds to reveal a proper smartphone screen running at 2520 x 1080 resolution with 120Hz adaptive refresh that shifts smoothly between 1Hz and 120Hz depending on the content. This primary display boasts HDR10+ for vibrant colors, going up to a peak brightness of 2600 nits that ensures perfect readability even in direct sunlight when its competitors all wash out completely. The external 4.1-inch Super AMOLED cover screen is a significant evolution from earlier tiny external screens, offering real utility for notification checking, music control, taking selfies, and running widgets without opening the phone. This cover display boasts a 1048 x 948 resolution and a matching 120Hz refresh for smooth interactions that make quick tasks possible without the unfolding ritual that earlier Flips required for everything.

The Samsung Exynos 2500 processor is built on an advanced 3nm manufacturing process and brings flagship performance with 10 cores that include high-performance Cortex-X5 cores reaching 3.3GHz. In practice, this processing power takes on-demand games, 4K video editing, and heavy multitasking without experiencing the thermal throttling or battery drain seen by earlier foldables that tried to pack flagship specs into severely constrained thermal envelopes.

This includes a dual-camera system with a 50MP main sensor featuring optical stabilization and 12MP ultra-wide captures for stunning photos that easily rival traditional flagship cameras, notwithstanding the engineering constraints of fitting quality optics into a folding form factor. Meanwhile, the f/1.8 aperture lets in substantial light for excellent performance in low light, while optical stabilization ensures sharp handheld shots even in challenging conditions. The ultra-wide lens captures expansive landscapes and group photos without the distortion that ruins cheaper implementations. Video recording tops out at 4K at 60fps, with enhanced stabilization for smooth footage when walking or shooting actively.

A 4300mAh battery capacity represents an upgrade over past generations while an efficient 3nm processor and adaptive display refresh come together to deliver all-day battery life through typical usage patterns. The 25W wired charging replenishes the battery relatively fast, though it lags some competitors that offer 65W or faster. The 15W wireless charging offers cable-free convenience, and the reverse wireless charging lets you top up the Galaxy Buds or another Qi-compatible device just by placing it on the back of the phone.

For less than the traditional premium phone price, the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 7 manages to deliver unique folding design, dual 120Hz displays, flagship Exynos 2500 performance, capable cameras and all-day battery life at this record Black Friday price on Amazon. Samsung’s seventh-generation refinement eliminates the compromises that made earlier foldables feel experimental rather than practical daily drivers.

item.title: Logitech Pushes MX Master 3S Wireless Mouse Into Black Friday Giveaway Mode After Last Month’s Sales Wipe Out Most Stock
item.content:encoded:
Take a moment to look down at your desk. What does your setup look like? How’s your keyboard? Are your speakers up to par? How many monitors are you using? When it comes to PC gaming, there’s virtually endless potential for upgrading your space. From the heart of your system—the GPU, CPU, and RAM—to the various gaming accessories like a mechanical keyboard or a high-quality surround sound headset, building your ultimate gaming setup can be a gradual process. One often overlooked accessory in this journey is the mouse. Sure, that cheap $10 one you picked up at the checkout counter last time you were at Staples gets the job done, but a mouse can be so much more than you might realize.

The Logitech MX Master 3S will kick your computer use up a notch, when gaming or otherwise. It’s normally listed at Amazon for an even $100, but this early Black Friday deal has the mouse discounted by 20%. It doesn’t take a mathematician to tell you that ends up saving your $20, bringing the price down to just $80 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

This high-precision gaming mouse is capable of 8K DPI tracking on any surface. You can even use the Logitech MX Master 3S smoothly across glass. Sensitivity is fully customizable so you can set it to your own personal sweet spot.

Clicks are quiet so you can work or game actively without disrupting anyone else in the room with you, be they co-workers, roommates, or your family. Even though its been made to significantly more quiet than other elite gaming mice on the market, this one still gives you that same satisfying, tactile feeling when clicking the button down.

Ultra-fast Scrolling

The Logitech MX Master 3S gaming mouse makes use of MagSpeed scrolling. It’s fast, precise, and near silent. You can scroll up to 1,000 lines in one second, easily.

This mouse has an ergonomic design so you can work comfortably with a more natural wrist posture. Your thumb rests on the side of the mouse where it also has access to a second scrolling wheel and two programmable buttons you can set with app specific profiles. This way you can optimize your workflows while also making your gameplay more efficient.

Do note that this is a Bluetooth Edition of the gaming mouse. That means it only supports connectivity over Bluetooth and does not come with any USB receiver, adapter, or charging cable. The Bluetooth Edition of the Logitech MX Master 3S gaming mouse has been knocked down to $80 from $100.

You can also opt instead to grab the model which comes with a USB receiver. This one is on sale for $20 off as well, bringing the price down from $120 to just and even $100 for a limited time.
